items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

  • The method isn’t used to determine whether anybody needs to use locks,
    it is used to determine whether the implementation uses locks or not
  • It does not have to return true for all valid BYTES_PER_ELEMENT values

MDN URL of the main page changed

no

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)

no

Anything else that could help us review it

I appreciate MDN a lot and want to say thank you either way :)
items.title: Clarify Atomics.isLockFree() description

What was wrong/why is this fix needed?

The button functions in the Toggle button example did not pass the event preventing them from working.

items.content_html:
This is part of #1146.

This converts the interface, properties & methods of api/v* to the {{Specifications}} macros.

A few pages don't get a spec table anymore (but a message):

  • All WebVR pages (VR*) as WebVR, though still implemented, is superseded by WebXR. I leave it that way. [64 pages!]
  • VTTRegion was missing a spec_url. This is fixed in mdn/browser-compat-table#11067
  • ValidityState.patternMismatch, ValidityState.rangeOverflow, ValidityState.rangeUnderflow and ValidityState.stepMismatch were missing the spec_url field. This is fixed in mdn/browser-compat-table#11068
  • VideoConfiguration is a dictionary without bcd. I leave it that way.

All other pages look fine.
items.title: Replace spec table with {{specifications}} for api/v*

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

Some pages relied on favicon images that would be part of the MDN platform. Clearly that didn't work out because MDN changed favicon images.
This PR solves that by download the images locally so the images are owned by the content and not optimistically dependent on something external.

MDN URL of the main page changed

See preview URLs

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)

Anything else that could help us review it

Based on #6001 (comment)
items.title: reference local favicon images

All other pages look fine.

items.content_html: This PR is a work in progress, proof-of-concept PR to remove ConstrainDouble from MDN web docs. The documentation is not complete, as this is intended to get an idea of what to do for this, and the other, typedefs. Part of work for #5975.
items.title: Remove ConstrainDouble

items.content_html:
This is part of #1146.

This converts the interface, properties & methods of api/t* to the {{Specifications}} macros.

A few pages don't get a spec table anymore (but a message):

  • TrustedScript and its 2 children,TrustedScriptURL and its 2 children, TrustedTypePolicyFactoryand its 9 children, and TrustedTypePolicy and its 4 children were missing both mdn_url and spec_url. (TrustedScript.toJSON, TrustedHTML.toJSON, and TrustedScriptURL.toJSON were also missing the compat section on bcd) All this is being fixed in mdn/browser-compat-data#11063.
  • TreeWalker.expandEntityReferences and Text.replaceWholeText are deprecated and therefore the link to the spec is outdated. I leave it that way.
  • TrackEvent() has no workng bcd table, so both will be fixed together.
  • TextTrackList.onremovetrack, TextTrackList.onchange, TextTrackList.onaddtrack, TextTrackCueListand its 2 children had no spec_url. This is fixed in mdn/browser-compat-data#11064

All other pages look fine.
items.title: Replace spec table with {{specifications}} for api/t*

items.content_html:
Part of #3047

Adds the global CSS value revert to a batch of CSS properties (those starting with a or b, which is a lot as CSS is mostly borders it turns out).

Also adding the global properties to those missing them.
items.title: Adding the global revert value to properties A and B

items.content_html: Fixes #5861
items.title: Adds release note

items.content_html: Fixes: #5919 by adding a clarifying sentence. I also reduced the height of some of the examples that were causing extra white space.
items.title: Adds a clarifying sentence

items.content_html:
This is part of #1146.

This converts the interface, properties & methods of api/s* (second part, up to Speech* included) to the {{Specifications}} macros.

A few pages don't get a spec table anymore (but a message):

  • ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.oncontentdelete, ServiceWorkerGlobalScope's contentdelete_event, and ServiceWorkerRegistration.index are a draft pages of a proposed API not yet implemented by anyone. I leave it as is for the moment (I hate these draft banners.)
  • ServiceWorkerGlobalScope's periodicsync_event and ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onperiodicsync are missing spec_url. This will be fixed in mdn/browser-compat-data#11054.
  • SourceBuffer.removeAsync() and SourceBuffer.appendBufferAsync() are non-standard. Their previous spec links weren't deep links anyway. I leave it that way.
  • SpeechGrammar() is non-standard, implemented only with a prefix and the previous link in the removed table was bogus. I keep it with the macro.

All other pages look fine.
items.title: Replace spec table with {{specifications}} for api/s* (part 2)

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

Add NaN for non-number dates.

MDN URL of the main page changed

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/getUTCMonth

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)

Fixes #6030

Anything else that could help us review it

This is as per the spec linked at the bottom of the page
items.title: Update return type of `Date.getUTCMonth` to include `NaN`

items.content_html:
DRAFT– Do not review this yet
This is part of #1146.

This converts the interface, properties & methods of api/rtc[j-z]* to the {{Specifications}} macros.

A few pages don't get a spec table anymore (but a message):

  • A few pages are deprecated and no more on the standard track; we keep the error messages (that will be improved in a 2nd pass): RTCPeerConnection.identityresult_event, RTCPeerConnection.peeridentity_event, RTCPeerConnection.idpvalidationerror_event, RTCPeerConnection.idpassertionerror_event, RTCSessionDescription().
  • Dictionaries and typedefs. Here these pages will be revisted (and have no bcd): so we keep them that way: RTCStats and its 3 children, RTCRtcpParameters, RTCStatsIceCandidatePairState, RTCRTPStreamStats and 1 children, RTCNetworkType.
  • RTCRtpSender.setStreams was missing spec_url and is fixed in mdn/browser-compat-data#11048.
  • RTCPeerConnectionIceErrorEvent.address is missing a BCD entry (and will be fixed inmdn/browser-compat-data#

All other pages look fine.
items.title: Replace spec table with {{specifications}} for api/rtc[j-z]* [DRAFT]
